Description: An open pottery bowl, probably made in Nile silt clay and red-slipped.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Naukratis, Well A (= Hogarth site 36)
Curator's comments: Excavated from a well by Hogarth in 1899 and said to be given to Bulak Museum in Cairo, although this object was not found registered in Cairo, Egyptian Museum (Edgar 1905, 123-5, Fig.3). The collection of pottery from this well was dated [inaccurately] by von Bissing to 525-323BC (Edgar 1905, 124-5).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IB.015)
